src:
Judy Ann may mga gustong makatrabaho sa kabilang network
04 Nov 2019, 11:25 by Aster Amoyo
NATUTUWA ang Teleserye Queen na si Judy Ann Santos sa successful collaboration ng mga stars and talents sa magkalabang TV networks sa paggawa ng pelikula na ang recent most successful pairing ay sa pamamagitan ng team-up nina Kathryn Bernardo at Alden Richards sa pelikulang “Hello, Love, Goodbye” na dinirek ni Cathy Garcia-Molina and produced by Star Cinema.  Ang nasabing pelikula ay siya ngayong may hawak ng highest local grossing film of all time matapos itong kumita sa takilya ng halos isang bilyong piso (including international screenings).
Nakagawa na rin sa Star Cinema at maging sa subsidiary nitong Black Sheep Productions at iba pang Kapuso stars and talents tulad nina Dingdong Dantes,  Jennylyn Mercado, Dennis Trillo at maging si Maine Mendoza.  Ang “Ang Probinsyano” lead actor and co-director na si Coco Martin ay katrabaho rin sa pelikula ang ilang actors na identified sa Kapuso network.
Kung sa telebisyon ay tila malabo pang magsama ang mga talents mula sa rival TV networks, nagiging posible naman ito sa pelikula.
Sa case ni Juday, hindi nito ikinakaila na gusto rin niyang makatrabaho sa pelikula ang ilang stars ng GMA tulad nina Heart Evangelista at Marian Rivera. Although nakatrabaho na niya ang Megastar na si Sharon Cuneta sa pamamagitan ng “Magkapatid” movie in 2002, gusto pa rin niya itong makatrabaho gayundin ang Asia’s Songbird na si Regine Velasquez.
text:
Judy Ann wants to work in the other network
04 Nov 2019, 11:25 by Aster Amoyo
Teleserye Queen Judy Ann Santos has been instrumental in the successful collaboration of stars and talents in two TV networks in the making of the latest most successful pairing through team-ups of Kathryn Bernardo and Alden Richards in the movie “Hello, Love , Goodbye ”directed by Cathy Garcia-Molina and produced by Star Cinema. The film is currently the highest grossing film of all time after earning a billion dollars (including international screenings).
It has also starred in Star Cinema and its subsidiaries Black Sheep Productions and other Kapuso stars and talents such as Dingdong Dantes, Jennylyn Mercado, Dennis Trillo and even Maine Mendoza. “The Provincial” lead actor and co-director Coco Martin has also worked in the film with several actors identified on the Kapuso network.
If television seems to be blurring the talent from rival TV networks, it is possible in the movie.
In Juday's case, it is undeniable that she also wanted to work in the film with some GMA stars like Heart Evangelista and Marian Rivera. Although she has already worked with Sharon Cuneta's Megastar through the "Brotherhood" movie in 2002, she still wants to work with Asia's Songbird Regine Velasquez.
